fields.descriptive_line:
[Leather panel] Gilt leather panel with a large floral scroll, with half of a floral device next to it. The decoration shows only half of the pattern of a vase (?) which is supported by two floral scrolls. The scrolls and devices are further ornamented with fruit. The pattern is gilded and silvered, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather panel with a large floral scroll, with half of a floral device next to it. The decoration shows only half of the pattern of a vase (?) which is supported by two floral scrolls. The scrolls and devices are further ornamented with fruit. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather panel with a large floral scroll, with half of a floral device next to it. The decoration shows only half of the pattern of a vase (?) which is supported by two floral scrolls. The scrolls and devices are further ornamented with fruit. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather panel with a large floral scroll, with half of a floral device next to it. The decoration shows only half of the pattern of a vase (?) which is supported by two floral scrolls. The scrolls and devices are further ornamented with fruit. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 500-1600.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather border with a repeating design of conventional pomegranates with scroll leaves on either side. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather border with a repeating design of conventional pomegranates with scroll leaves on either side. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather border with a repeating design of conventional pomegranates with scroll leaves on either side. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.

[Leather panel] Gilt leather border with a repeating design of conventional pomegranates with scroll leaves on either side. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.

[Leather panel] A quarter of a gilt leather border with a repeating design of conventional pomegranates with scroll leaves on either side. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.

[Leather panel] A quarter of a gilt leather border with a repeating design of conventional pomegranates with scroll leaves on either side. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground, Italy, ca. 1500-1600.
fields.physical_description:
[Leather panel] Gilt leather panel with a large floral scroll, with half of a floral device next to it. The decoration shows only half of the pattern of a vase (?) which is supported by two floral scrolls. The scrolls and devices are further ornamented with fruit. The pattern in gold and silver, and outlined in dark lines on a red ground. The gilded and silvered parts have been punched with several different stamps. This panel was part of a large hanging, described originally as: Gilt leather hanging consisting of four panels, with six borders at the top and the bottom. In the centre is a portion of a vase (?) from which springs a floral scroll on either side, with a floral device between. The vase (?) is supported by two similar scrolls which help to form a repeating pattern. The scrolls and devices are further ornamented with fruit. The borders are made up of a repeating design of conventional pomegranates with scroll leaves on either side. The whole is executed in red, gold, and silver on a red ground, and is further decorated with small diaper patterns.

fields.history_note:
Formerly described as 'Florentine, 16th century'. There is, however, no exact information available (not in Italy or elsewhere) to keep this attribution any longer standing. The whole group of  panels and hangings that were acquired from Bardini were, without any exception, being described in this way, although for instance inventory number 732-1890 has proven to be of a Dutch origin. Information supplied by Eloy Koldeweij, October 1996.

Purchase price of £1000 for a group of leather objects (museum numbers: 682-1890 to 732-1890).
